| Urodynamic parameters |

[Explanation: Urodynamic parameters are not diseases per se, but rather measurements used to assess various conditions related to the urinary system. However, they can indicate the presence of certain diseases or disorders. For example, abnormal bladder pressure-volume relationships or capacities can be indicative of various bladder conditions such as neurogenic bladder or interstitial cystitis.]

Urodynamic parameters is not a specific chemical entity, it is a term used to describe a set of measurements related to the function of the lower urinary tract.
